programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: The death of Sharon and Tracey's Aunt Sylvie soon has them jetting off to Hollywood in search of their real father. Festive special of the comedy from 1993, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson, with guest appearances by George Hamilton, George Wendt and Richard Branson

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Ambitious new DS Samantha Nixon arrives at Sun Hill and soon impresses everyone with her profiling skills. Danny Glaze casts a shadow over Des Taviner's future by making it clear that he won't lie under oath, while Reg Hollis co-operates with the kidnapping inquiry but seems oddly vague on some points. Lisa Maxwell and Paul Usher star

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Love-struck Gilmore is desperate to speak to Ashton but the object of his affections is more taken with Young's romantic overtures. Hunter sets up an undercover operation at a nightclub run by notorious drugs baron Mick Mortimer and Nixon gets an unexpected promotion, while Meadows and Webb continue their efforts to dig the dirt on Chandler. Guest starring Roger Lloyd Pack

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Mysterious nocturnal goings-on disturb the peace at a Sun Hill almshouse and Klein faces a dilemma when he's offered some cocaine while working undercover at Mortimer's club. Meadows and Webb have little success in their attempts to probe Chandler's past and Gilmore is furious to realise Ashton and Young have spent the night together

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Carver urges Ackland to move in with him, stepping up the pressure as they investigate the case at the almshouses, where a resident is now critically ill. Hunter obtains incriminating video footage of Nick Klein, while Meadows and Webb talk to Anne Merrick about Superintendent Tom Chandler's past - but aren't prepared for what she tells them. Rene Zagger and Scott Maslen star

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The locals excitedly prepare for the summer fete, featuring a baby show for which Trixie volunteers to secure a celebrity judge. Not everyone is in the mood for a party, however, as Jenny finds when she meets Nora Harding, a mother-of-eight distraught that she will soon have another mouth to feed. The midwife does her best to reassure the desperate mum, but her words fall on deaf ears and Nora ends up taking matters into her own hands. Jessica Raine and Helen George star, with a guest appearance by Sharon Small (Mistresses)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: With the advent of a mass X-ray programme to diagnose tuberculosis early, Dr Turner is determined that Poplar will no longer live under the threat of the disease. Meanwhile, Jenny's district nursing rounds lead her to the Mastersons, who suffered devastating misfortune from TB, and she works to reconcile the dying father with his only remaining daughter, Julia. Having succeeded in securing a visit from a screening van, Dr Turner and the midwives endure a busy day, but little can prepare them for what the results will mean for one of their own. Guest starring Karl Johnson (Lark Rise to Candleford)

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Dwelling Place
programme.desc: Feature-length adaptation of the best-selling novel, telling the tale of a 16-year-old struggling to keep her five brothers and sisters out of the workhouse with the help of a kindly carpenter. Starring James Fox, Tracy Whitwell and Edward Rawle-Hicks

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: The sleuth receives a cryptic letter from a recently deceased acquaintance asking her to conduct a mysterious investigation. Instructed only to go on a coach tour of historic homes around England, she uncovers murder and intrigue. Feature-length mystery, starring Joan Hickson, with Peter Tilbury, John Horsley and Helen Cherry

programme.title: Inspector Alleyn Mysteries
programme.desc: The detective investigates a blackmailer at large on the London debutante scene by planting old friend Lord Robert Gospell as a mole. However, the pair fail to prevent a murder. Feature-length drama, starring Patrick Malahide and Harold Innocent

programme.title: McMafia
programme.desc: Alex receives an offer from someone claiming to be an old friend, but has no idea who is behind it. Semiyon seeks backing for his business venture from both American business interests and the Israeli government - while Lyudmilla uncovers the darkest secrets his potential investors are hiding. Benes' operation grows in power, sending a concerned Vadim to Prague in search of answers

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: When a series of monstrous and seemingly indiscriminate killings become ever more audacious and public, DCI John Luther and new recruit DS Catherine Halliday are confounded by a complex tangle of leads and misdirection that seems designed to protect an untouchable corruption. But, even as the case brings him closer than ever to the true face of evil, a reluctant Luther is forced to confront the unburied demons of his own recent past. Idris Elba stars, with Wunmi Mosaku and Patrick Malahide

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Havers returns to work and is forced to confront demons from her past as the team investigates the case of a woman murdered with a shotgun. A cryptic word painted at the crime scene and the discovery of a mysterious photo lead the police to think the killer is sending them clues, and further investigations uncover a secret the local community has been trying to hide

programme.title: Leonardo
programme.desc: Seeking a new career, Leonardo ventures to the city of Milan with a determination to claim an offer of patronage from the Duke Regent, Ludovico Sforza

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Hunter refuses to back off as the undercover operation spirals out of control and Klein reveals confidential information while under the influence of cocaine. McAllister returns to work, and hopes to keep her pregnancy a secret, but a female colleague is already working out who the father might be. Meanwhile, Sam reckons she has found the serial killer, and Mickey Webb inadvertently drives another nail in Chandler's coffin

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: After a traumatic few months, Little Mo decides to put the past behind her. Lisa's choice is made more difficult when Mark gives her a surprise. Is Sadie quite what she seems?

programme.desc: News of Little Mo and Billy's relationship pleases the Slaters

programme.desc: Beth and Jack are excited about their wedding day, but their friends' idyllic marriage reveals deeper feelings which bring them down to earth. Starring Amanda Burton and Kevin Whately

programme.desc: The truth about Alistair's wedding nerves is revealed after he and Lionel spill the beans, but Rocky comes to the rescue to ensure the ceremony finally takes place. Jean refuses to give up on her efforts to play Cupid between Harry and Sandy

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth's wealthy acquaintance Mrs Fortescue, whose sister married a baronet, asks her for a lift into town - but things do not go according to plan. Patricia Routledge stars

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Seymour reveals his latest invention - a purse for men. Compo agrees to test the product, which results in minor havoc. Comedy, with Bill Owen, Michael Aldridge and Peter Sallis

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team tracks vicious criminal Chopper Hadley, who is back in the country for a week, with Brian going undercover to apprehend the villain. Patrick Malahide (The Inspector Alleyn Mysteries) guest stars, with Dennis Waterman, James Bolam and Alun Armstrong

programme.title: Clocking Off
programme.desc: Tensions both at home and the factory finally lead Mack to breaking point. Feeling he can no longer cope, he decides it is time to make a major change in his life, and when ne'er-do-well brother Eddie puts in an unexpected appearance, the perfect opportunity seems to have presented itself. Philip Glenister and Craig Kelly star

programme.title: Bad Girls
programme.desc: Six weeks after Yvonne's apparent escape, Fenner feels he is starting to unravel, plagued by nightmares about his hard-faced adversary and unsure whether she managed to wriggle out of his trap. Meanwhile, the girls are blissfully unaware of his evil scheming, and continue to celebrate the former top-dog's success - and her actions even inspire another inmate to make a bid for freedom - will all go to plan? Elsewhere, Bev's alcohol-raddled body struggles to cope with the effects of her new favourite fix, fresh faces cause a stir in the cells and the identity of the wing governor is announced

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Lady Jane persuades Lovejoy to act as driver for an old friend who has to attend her sea-faring brother's burial. The roguish antiques dealer is given the job of selling the late captain's Second World War medals, and there is a smart fashion photographer who wants them. However, some drunken sailors then come into the picture and Lovejoy finds himself dealing with the gun-toting Italian Angelo Pantaloni. Light-hearted drama, with Ian McShane

programme.desc: Faced with the Nazis' ban on Jewish emigration, Aracy reluctantly enlists Zumkle to help her get a pair of children out of the country before it is too late

programme.desc: The day of Robyn and Glen's wedding arrives, but the groom has a seizure while getting ready at the hotel. Rash treats a woman suffering from anxiety after the death of her fiance

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: When another body turns up on the banks of the Thames, Klein fears his club 'colleague' Sandie could be the Sun Hill serial killer's latest victim, and Chandler walks into a tight corner when he visits Anne Merrick to prove his innocence. programme.desc: A lonely boy, neglected by his father and bullied at school, finds comfort in a mysterious book about a young hero's quest to save his world from destruction. However, as he reads the tale, he begins to become part of the story. Fantasy adventure based on Michael Ende's novel, starring Barret Oliver, Noah Hathaway, Gerald McRaney, Moses Gunn and Patricia Hayes

programme.title: Serengeti
programme.desc: As the drought ends and the land returns to its former beauty, newborn giraffe Twiga takes his tentative first steps, trying to control his gangly legs - and he must learn quickly as lioness Kali is on the prowl. Another baby enters the elephant herd, and shortly after the newborn's father appears to greet his son in an awe-inspiring moment. Mafuta and the rest of the hippos return to the river, only to find the crocodiles have laid claim to the riverbank - so the hippos try to evict their old enemies

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Celebrating the 70th anniversary of the first recorded summit of the highest point on earth, Mount Everest, Ellie Harrison heads to Kettering and one of the world's most advanced materials research facilities to put outdoor gear - and herself - to the test. As well as getting to grips with a pair of expedition boots that made it to the top of the world, how will Ellie bear up in a cold chamber where the mercury can hit -40 degrees centigrade? Ellie also dips into the Countryfile archive to remember some pretty bracing encounters with the worst the weather can hurl at people

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents a special edition paying tribute to the nursing profession, filmed at St Thomas's and St Bartholomew's hospitals in the heart of London. The programme features objects that provide an insight into the history of nursing and healthcare, from medals awarded for bravery to early uniforms, cartoons and medical equipment. Fiona also meets comedian Jo Brand, a former psychiatric nurse, and hears the story of Jennifer Worth - the author of Call the Midwife

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The countdown to Trixie and Matthew's wedding officially begins, with Sister Veronica taking charge of organising the wedding gifts, while the bride's brother Geoffrey arriving and setting out to arrange the perfect hen party. However, the nuptials cause stress levels to escalate as a catalogue of disasters threaten to spoil the day. Meanwhile, a car crash leaves Dr Turner facing the biggest test of his career when he left to save a precious life, Nancy considers her and Colette's future and Sister Julienne hatches a plan to save Nonnatus House once and for all

programme.title: The Gold
programme.desc: DCI Boyce sets up surveillance on Noye's house in Kent, and they soon strike lucky when they follow Brian Reader from the property to a gold merchants in Bristol. As the evidence builds, raids are organised to arrest the gang, only for the operation to end in tragedy

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents highlights and analysis of the Premier League match between Tottenham Hotspur and Chelsea at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium. The London rivals shared the spoils in an entertaining 2-2 draw when they met at Stamford Bridge in August. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: Motty - The Man Behind the Sheepskin
programme.desc: An insight into the career of football commentator John Motson. The programme takes a look back at some of the moments and matches that have made him so popular with radio listeners and TV viewers, and features contributions from his wife Annie and son Freddie, colleagues Gary Lineker, Ian Wright, Trevor Brooking and Mark Lawrenson, and celebrity fans Noel Gallagher and Rod Stewart

programme.title: Moon (2009)
programme.desc: Astronaut Sam Bell has been working alone at an energy-generating base on the moon for three years and desperately longs to return home. After he is injured in an accident, he begins to discover the disturbing truth about the operation he is running, and is forced to question his own identity. Sci-fi drama, starring Sam Rockwell, with the voice of Kevin Spacey

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead

programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Kym Marsh host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood presents the story of an anxious family's 999 call to the police as they watched an intruder prowling around downstairs, live on their home security camera

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A house fire ends in tragedy when an attempt to cash-in on an insurance payout goes terribly wrong, and a window cleaner who says he cannot work is caught out on camera

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell visit two neighbouring cottages in Derbyshire, a terrace in Bolton and a semi in Leeds before they are sold under the hammer

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion and the teams shop for antiques in Peterborough, where experts Catherine Southon and Kate Bliss are on hand to help with the search. Christina flummoxes the fairgoers with a 2,000-year-old antique, and then it's off to Lichfield for the day's auction

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Rob treats Karen to a special night while Kirsty and Rich come to an understanding. Emma encourages Luca to talk to Jamie and Ruhma goes on a blind date

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: For Louise and Olly, a prize for their Beltex sheep at the Mid Devon Show is vital for their future. Amelia and Ben's Charollais sheep also meet the best breeders in the country

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a London couple on their country house hunt in Wiltshire. They have a generous ¬£1million budget to afford them space for their prized possessions - a baby grand piano and classic cars. Away from the property search, Nicki discovers more about the art of wooden hat block making, a critically endangered heritage craft being kept alive by a Wiltshire-based family whose blocks are used by milliners across the world

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Dealers Irita Marriot and Mark Hill set out on their first trip together. Irita buys a very rare tea-set, while Mark invests in mid-century Italian ceramics

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Quiz show hosted by Ross Kemp in which contestants compete for cash by crossing a bridge made up of stepping stones, each of which has a different option. The players must try to get from A to B by stepping on the truths and avoiding the lies in order to cross the studio floor safely, or risk falling off the bridge and out of the game

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: The One Show

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Zack and Whitney receive their baby's test results and Nish and Suki's marriage blessing ceremony is brought forward. A guilt-riddled Denise seduces Jack, and Denzel is shortlisted for 'The Walford Young Writers Competition'

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Whitney makes a difficult decision and Denzel's lies are exposed. Stacey and Eve re-open the bap van but chaos ensues when Nish accosts Eve while she's working. After Nish invites Honey to the marriage blessing, Suki is left in an awkward position

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Crisis pregnancy advice centres are supposed to help women with unplanned pregnancies, but an investigation reveals evidence that some clinics, operating outside the NHS, are giving misleading information and offering counselling that could persuade women not to have abortions. Reporter Divya Talwar also uncovers links between some UK centres and the anti-abortion movement in America

programme.title: Better
programme.desc: Col's latest attempt to procure an additional supply of drugs comes up short so he puts plans in place to get in touch with another associate in Bradford, but this is deemed a reckless move given he already has a deal with another family in the city, threatening to trigger a gang war. Owen and Donal grow ever closer, while Esther becomes curious about Lou's erratic behaviour

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: It's sink or swim for the trainees as they face the daunting Water Power Challenge, aptly named Sink or Swim - and one trainee is tempted to ditch their Warrior

programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: Romance is in the air as a new trainee turns up the heat and, in the most brutal challenge yet, some trainees are pushed to breaking point. Presented by Jordan North and Paul Olima

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Oscar-winner Helen Mirren discusses her role in Shazam! Fury of the Gods. Multi award-winning actress, singer and dancer Ariana DeBose also appears, alongside Narcos star Pedro Pascal, who is promoting the new series of The Mandalorian. Plus, Freya Ridings performs her current single Weekends

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: A detective uncovers a criminal who has been targeting elderly people. A homeless musician's guitar is stolen by a mystery man and car thieves are caught struggling

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: Insurance investigators turn the tables on a woman claiming ¬£690,000 for personal injury claim after a surveillance operation reveals she's living life to the full. Plus, a minor bump on a petrol forecourt results in a false claim for whiplash. Presented by Naga Munchetty

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The redevelopment of a million-pound-plus house in Fulham, as well as the progress of auction buys in St Helens near Liverpool and Stoke in Staffordshire

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents the show from Wrexham, and discovers the story of The Ladies of Llangollen. Roo Irvine and Philip Serrell provide expert advice to today's teams

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Ollie comes home from the Army with a surprise, while Nina arrives at the Mill and makes her mark. Scarlett is asked out by old work colleague, but he's getting 'coaching' on how to seduce her

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Beekeepers Debbie and Chris collect honey from their hives, while vegetable and fruit farmers Paul and Jackie gather their crops for the Winchester Farmer's Market

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah goes property shopping in rural Devon with a couple who have a ¬£350,000 budget and hope to find a home that has both a workshop and an art studio

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Irita and Mark continue their road trip looking for antique treasures in Bedford. Irita is excited by a 200 year-old regency ornament while Mark finds some Victorian anatomy moulds

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Ross Kemp hosts the game show in which friends Lauren, Kate, Katie and Emily walk across the bridge, stepping on the truths and avoiding the lies, in a bid to take home the cash

programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Fulham v Leeds United (Kick-off 7.45pm). Gary Lineker presents all the action from the fifth-round tie at Craven Cottage. Goals by Aleksandar Mitrovic, Bobby Decordova-Reid and Willian helped Fulham record a 3-2 win when the sides met in the Premier League at Elland Road in October. They will be hopeful of recording a second victory of the season against United now they have home advantage, but Leeds may see this tie as a welcome distraction from their struggles in the Premier League. With analysis from Micah Richards, Danny Murphy and Jermaine Beckford

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Rain Man (1988)
programme.desc: Brash yuppie car dealer Charlie discovers his deceased father has left the family fortune to Raymond, the autistic elder brother he never knew he had. In a bid to get his hands on the money, he tracks down and abducts Raymond - but the ensuing cross-country journey proves to be a profound learning experience for them both. Oscar-winning drama, starring Tom Cruise and Dustin Hoffman, with Valeria Golino, Gerald R Molen and Jack Murdock

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the second of four compilation programmes, Monty Don plants tender annuals for high summer colour, as well as sharing his tips for growing cherries and pruning blackcurrants. Plus, Arit Anderson discovers a paradise garden in Cambridge

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Adam Henson and Charlotte Smith head to Bakewell Livestock Market in Derbyshire, as hundreds of sheep and cattle are auctioned. Among the farmers looking to make a penny or two is Keith Harrop, who is hoping to get top dollar for one of his beef cattle, but will business be brisk enough? As well as following a busy market day, Charlotte discovers the history of markets and how Bakewell is adapting for the future with pop-up shops and also a pop-in health clinic, while Joe Crowley is in East Anglia, where a proposed new multi-billion pound power grid has been met with stiff opposition

programme.title: Life in a Cottage Garden with Carol Klein
programme.desc: Winter has arrived and harsh frosts have shattered the tulip pots and ruined the brick paths, so Carol takes shelter in the potting shed and prepares her garlic for spring planting. On finer days, she begins pruning late-flowering clematis, and begins a major revamp in the borders when the thaw comes. While the trees and shrubs are still in their dormancy in February, a local woodsman arrives to lay a native hedge

programme.title: Weatherman Walking: The Welsh Coast
programme.desc: Derek Brockway's walk in Cardigan Bay has something for everyone. For the first half he's at one with nature as he explores one of Britain's largest and oldest raised peat bogs. His route then takes him to a unique railway museum, filled with nostalgia and he also discovers the legend of Cantre Gwaelod at Sarn Cynfelyn where the shingle spit stretches an incredible 11kms out to sea. He finishes at the university town of Aberystwyth with its Victorian cliff-top pleasure park, complete with camera obscura. Derek also has a go at paddle-boarding - which has its challenges

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents more highlights from the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef glimpses life in Cornwall 2,000 years ago as he explores the atmospheric ruins of the ancient village of Carn Euny. Rick also cooks his favourite Sunday lunch, a hearty steak and kidney pudding, and goes for a bracing ride on a beautiful hand-built boat

programme.title: Mary Berry's Fantastic Feasts
programme.desc: Mary helps three novice cooks to prepare a special birthday feast for a London teacher. The students learn to prepare blinis with three toppings, salmon en croute with a spinach and herb sauce, and a birthday chocolate ganache cake. Meanwhile, Scarlett Moffatt and Janette Manrara are on hand to help, hitting the sweet shops on a special mission to help the birthday boy's pupils make a special contribution to the festivities

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Short
programme.desc: Simon King and David Myers take a trip through Romania, where they visit the imposing Corvin Castle and cook pork sarmales by the drawbridge

programme.title: Italy's Invisible Cities
programme.desc: Using new 3D technology, Alexander Armstrong and Dr Michael Scott explore the Italian city of Florence, and with the help of historian Ross King and the team, they discover the hidden secrets of Florence's great cathedral and its architectural genius. The pair also learn more about the Medici's fraught relationship with Michelangelo, as he fell from favour when he supported a rebellion against his own masters, and visit the world-famous Uffizi - including the Botticelli room

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Chelsea v Arsenal (Kick-off 2.00pm). All the action from the fifth-round tie at Kingsmeadow. Chelsea are the holders of the competition, having defeated the Gunners 2-0 in last season's semi-finals before overcoming Manchester City after extra time in the showpiece match. The sides also met in the 2021 final, with the Blues also taking the honours on that occasion with a 3-0 win

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: People are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking a risk at auction

programme.title: Chariots of Fire (1981)
programme.desc: Oscar-winning drama based on the true story of British runners Eric Liddell and Harold Abrahams, going for gold at the 1924 Olympics in Paris. The two athletes are driven by very different impulses - Liddell is inspired by his devout Christian faith, while Abrahams hopes to triumph over the anti-Semitism he has endured all his life. Starring Ian Charleson, Ben Cross, Nigel Havers, John Gielgud and Ian Holm. Vangelis provides the soundtrack

programme.title: Six Nations Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the third round of fixtures, featuring Italy v Ireland at Aviva Stadium, Wales v England at Principality Stadium and France v Scotland at Stade de France. Ireland and Scotland were the only teams who still had a chance of winning the Grand Slam after the first two rounds, but England and France will both have felt they could stay in championship contention with a win

programme.title: Secrets of the Jurassic Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Part two of two. Liz Bonnin joins the palaeontologists as they unearth the remains of fearsome Jurassic predators, with the team considering if the site was a dinosaur hunting ground. They try to figure out if these predators were involved in the deaths of supersized beasts like the diplodocus buried at the site, helping to reveal why so many dinosaurs came here, and what killed them in such great numbers 150 million years ago

programme.title: The Warship: Tour of Duty
programme.desc: After six months at sea on its first operational deployment, HMS Queen Elizabeth departs the Pacific for the long voyage home. After crossing the Arabian Sea, the ship stops at Duqm in Oman to replenish stores, before proceeding up the Red Sea, through the Suez canal and into the eastern Mediterranean. An F35 jet on a routine launch loses power at a critical moment and the pilot has to eject, and HMS Queen Elizabeth launches a search and rescue mission to locate the airman

programme.title: The King's Speech (2010)
programme.desc: The younger son of George V struggles to cope with an uncontrollable stammer, prompting his wife to enlist the aid of an eccentric Australian speech therapist. The support and friendship of the doctor prove invaluable when a crisis places the repressed prince on the throne, just as the outbreak of the Second World War leaves the country in need of a strong king. Oscar-winning fact-based drama, starring Colin Firth, Geoffrey Rush, Helena Bonham Carter and Guy Pearce

programme.title: Tulip Fever (2017)
programme.desc: In 17th-century Amsterdam at the height of tulip mania, an artist falls in love with a married woman whose portrait he has been commissioned to paint. Historical romance based on Deborah Moggach's novel, starring Alicia Vikander, Dane DeHaan and Jack O'Connell

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in Cardiff to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Stacey and her team help the Harris-Hawley family transform their home. Childhood sweethearts Dan and Char along with their daughters Mia and Cece realise just how much unnecessary clutter they own when they take everything out and see it displayed in front of them. The family go through their most treasured items full of emotion, reflecting on the tough times they've come through ahead of their wedding which is just one week away

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: David Harper and Catherine Southon explore shops in Devon. Both are 'on the tiles' at Kingsbridge, but while Catherine opts for more traditional items, David scoops up an eel spear and a fetish doll, hoping for luck with the more outlandish. Their final auction is at Broughton Astley in Leicestershire

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Friends Romanda, Subs, Raj and Dee compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Winterwatch
programme.desc: Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan are back in Wild Ken Hill in Norfolk, where they update viewers on the weekend dramas that have played out on the live cameras. They also revel in the rich habitat of nearby estuary the Wash, which draws thousands of avian migrants every winter and supports its own resident species all year round. Iolo Williams and Gillian Burke continue to explore Edinburgh, showcasing the Water of Leith as well providing an insight into the badgers' weekend antics on the cameras

programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the game show in which 24 recurring contestants compete for the chance to win a ¬£10,000 jackpot, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Holding Back the Years
programme.desc: Rangan Chatterjee looks at the rise of the granny annex and how it could put an end to loneliness in old age , while Fiona Phillips road-tests the marriage MOT, designed for over-50s who are approaching retirement and want the state of their relationship looked at by a professional

programme.title: Big Cats
programme.desc: Documentary following ultimate cat species from around the world, from the lions of Tanzania - the only cat species to live in groups - to the tiny rusty spotted cat of Sri Lanka, 200 times smaller than a lion but just as curious. The film also peeks into the secret lives of the Canada lynx, which lives further north than any cat, and follows an African leopard and mother, which for a decade has worn a radio collar allowing scientists to follow every twist and turn of her existence

programme.title: Make Me a Dealer
programme.desc: Paul Martin is in Shropshire with Sandra Zhang from Coventry and Ian Tully from Preston. They will be spending their hard earned cash in the hope they can make a profit

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Philip Serrell and Nick Davies scour the crowd at Tilbury Docks in Essex to find objects to take off to auction, while Paul Martin explores the history of the docks

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Nihal Arthanayake, Jake Humphrey, Patsy Kensit and Mae Martin go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of commercial diving engineers as they battle time and tide to keep Britain's coastlines and waterways moving. In the first edition, Brighton Marina's main jetty is on the tilt causing chaos for residents and shop owners, so the team devises a plan using air bags to fix it in record time. Young diver Kai reveals how fitness is key to the job they do, and he faces danger when the low tide threatens to bring the concrete jetty down on his head. Craig Parkinson narrates

programme.title: A Special School
programme.desc: Thieves break into the school and take valuable watersport equipment, while Leo has written his very own love song for Valentine's Day, and Liam learns what impact his Prader-Willi syndrome could have on puberty. The summer show is one of the highlights of the year in Ysgol y Deri, and as rehearsals get under way, deputy head teacher Kerrie has her director's hat on

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: Clive Myrie invites four more contestants to brave the black chair, answering questions on the specialist subjects of the Empress Matilda, Stevie Nicks, the What Katy Did novels, and Universal's Frankenstein films of the 1930s and '40s, before they are tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts as the Scrummagers take on the Crustaceans in the concluding semi-final as the two teams compete to guess the connections between things that seem utterly random at first glance. One set of clues asks what links Spread out, Heap, Lock of hair, and Heap of rainstorm

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: In the first of the quarter-final matches, two teams of four students compete to make it to the next stage of the competition as they try to win two matches to progress to the semi-finals. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions

programme.title: Parole
programme.desc: The parole board considers the cases of two serious offenders. Fifteen years ago, Matthew violently murdered a young woman on a public street. A recently converted Christian, he now has the chance to move to an open prison where he will come into contact with the public. After being convicted for arson, 26-year-old Simran was caught dealing class A drugs. Halfway through his four-and-a-half year sentence, he has the chance to be released into the community. Will his history of mental health problems compromise this opportunity?

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: Sophie seems to be making progress with her new friend at the library, while the club is visited by the mayor on a matter of some delicacy. Peter's quest to find his grandmother has attracted the attention of some old enemies and Andy spots something suspicious. Comedy, starring Mackenzie Crook, Toby Jones, Aimee-Ffion Edwards and Daniel Donskov

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, presented by Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: The Sisters Brothers (2018)
programme.desc: In the American West during the 1850s, gunfighter brothers Eli and Charlie Sisters are employed by a rich businessman, known as the Commodore. He hires them to kill Hermann Warm, who eventually reveals that he is en route to find gold using a chemical formula of his own invention. Western, starring John C Reilly, Joaquin Phoenix, Jake Gyllenhaal, Riz Ahmed and Rutger Hauer in one of his final film roles

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Adam Henson and Charlotte Smith head to Bakewell Livestock Market in Derbyshire, as hundreds of sheep and cattle are auctioned. Among the farmers looking to make a penny or two is Keith Harrop, who is hoping to get top dollar for one of his beef cattle, but will business be brisk enough? As well as following a busy market day, Charlotte discovers the history of markets and how Bakewell is adapting for the future with pop-up shops and also a pop-in health clinic, while Joe Crowley is in East Anglia, where a proposed new multi-billion pound power grid has been met with stiff opposition

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: An entrepreneur promoting portable toilets for youngsters hopes to flush away any doubts of success, while mushroom snacks with an impressive crunch prove too noisy for one potential investor. Plus, a sustainable clothing entrepreneur returns to the Den for a second time. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Aspiring makers are given the opportunity to turn their hobbies and skills into money-making businesses, joining Dom Chinea at a training camp in the grounds of an Arts and Crafts house in Leicestershire. Izzy has given up a career in advertising to try to become a full-time potter. Stone carver Luke needs help overcoming a serious confidence problem that is holding him back

They then make garlic mushroom pakoras, beetroot-stuffed paratha and rhubarb, rose and cardamom kulfi. Willl the restaurant owners be impressed by the ingredients?

programme.desc: Claudia Winkleman appeals on behalf of Roald Dahl's Marvellous Children's Charity, which funds specialist nurses to help seriously ill children and support their families in the UK

programme.title: Holding Back the Years
programme.desc: Featuring a 101-year-old man who suffered a horrific burglary and Dr Rangan Chatterjee visits Planet of the Vapes to see if e-cigarettes should be available on the NHS

programme.title: Big Cats
programme.desc: The second documentary looks at how cats have adapted to the challenges of life in almost every environment on Earth. The margay leaps through the treetops in the Central American jungle, while the pregnant jaguar waits for thousands of turtles to arrive on a remote Pacific beach. In the Karoo region of South Africa, a tiny black-footed cat stakes its claim to the title of the world's deadliest feline, and in Outer Mongolia, the Pallas's cat is able to disguise itself as a rock - a useful trick while hunting

programme.title: Make Me a Dealer
programme.desc: Contestants from Sussex and Northamptonshire take part in the antiques challenge, presented by Paul Martin. The pair are shown the tricks of the trade before an auction showdown

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: People are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking a risk at auction

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Nihal Arthanayake, Jake Humphrey, Patsy Kensit and Mae Martin go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: Cargo in a British port grinds to a halt when a tugboat picks up a mystery object in its propeller. The divers respond to a callout to get the tug moving again, and end up using everything at their disposal - even a kitchen knife - in an attempt to free the propeller from whatever has been dumped in the river

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: The crew at Tower, on the River Thames in London, is the busiest of all the lifeboat stations, averaging more than 500 shouts a year and aiming to launch to any emergency in under 90 seconds. When a call comes in about a man in the water near the Thames Barrier, they reach him with just moments to spare. In Fleetwood, on the Lancashire coast, a desperate 999 call alerts the crew to a bait digger - out looking for worms on the sand flats - who has been caught out by the incoming spring tide and is in danger of being submerged and swept out to sea

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from Scotland serve up their canapes, starters and fish dishes on an animation and illustration theme. The vegan starters includes a posh prison porridge inspired by the time Dennis the Menace's mischief landed him behind bars and a celebration of Bananaman using plantain three ways. The fish course, meanwhile, includes a delicately barbecued salmon belly with a caramelized whey sauce and bilberry gel, inspired by a scene in Disney's Brave, while another chef has fun with celebrated Scottish comic strip Oor Wullie, creating a scallop and crab lasagne bucket with a shellfish bisque and stuffed razor clam

programme.title: The Mormons Are Coming
programme.desc: Following three young missionaries through training, as they give up their names and become Elders and Sisters who live under a strict time table with limited contact with family, will any of them go the distance? This documentary brings a unique insight into who the Mormons are from young believers who are passionate about their faith

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: A selection of the best moments from the T series, hosted by Sandi Toksvig with regular panellist Alan Davies

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Faisal Islam

programme.title: Parole
programme.desc: The parole board considers the cases of two serious offenders. Fifteen years ago, Matthew violently murdered a young woman on a public street. A recently converted Christian, he now has the chance to move to an open prison where he will come into contact with the public. After being convicted for arson, 26-year-old Simran was caught dealing class A drugs. Halfway through his four-and-a-half year sentence, he has the chance to be released into the community. Will his history of mental health problems compromise this opportunity?

programme.title: The Warship: Tour of Duty
programme.desc: After six months at sea on its first operational deployment, HMS Queen Elizabeth departs the Pacific for the long voyage home. After crossing the Arabian Sea, the ship stops at Duqm in Oman to replenish stores, before proceeding up the Red Sea, through the Suez canal and into the eastern Mediterranean. An F35 jet on a routine launch loses power at a critical moment and the pilot has to eject, and HMS Queen Elizabeth launches a search and rescue mission to locate the airman

programme.title: Tokyo Vice
programme.desc: With few other options, Samantha decides to risk everything to get Polina back safely. Jake receives a threatening visit from Tozawa's men, and the message is clear - stay away. But Katagiri has a plan to deal with Tozawa

programme.title: Surgeons: At the Edge of Life
programme.desc: The Addenbrooke's trauma surgeons take two patients from resus to the operating theatre to give them life-saving treatment. The first is 55-year-old Carolyn, who has been involved in a road traffic accident. Despite a cerebral bleed, her most critical injuries are to her pelvis and her heel, which has an open fracture. Meanwhile, 75-year-old Joan has been knocked over by a van, leaving her with multiple injuries. The main question is whether her foot, which has lost a lot of skin, can be saved

programme.title: Amanda & Alan's Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden purchases two dilapidated apartments nestled in the sun-kissed hills of rural Sicily, intending to raise them from their ruins and create luxury holiday homes. The hope is that she and workmate friend Alan Carr to make a huge profit they can donate to charity. After arriving at the crumbling property for the first time, the piles of rubbish and abandoned junk suggest to both that that this visit will be no holiday

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Come Dancing
programme.desc: Terry Wogan presents the start of the 1977 season of the inter-regional amateur dance contest, which sees couples from Midland and West taking on Home Counties South at the Locarno Ballroom, Bradford. There's also a professional Latin American demonstration from David Douglass and Janice Barb, and Barry Haynes provides the commentary

programme.title: Inside Classical
programme.desc: The BBC Scottish Symphony Orchestra perform Ravel's ballet score Daphnis and Chlo√©, and Olivier Messiaen's series of songs Po√®mes pour Mi, under the baton of Ryan Wigglesworth in his debut as chief conductor. From Glasgow's City Halls

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: A look back at the glamorous heyday of the jet set, from the 1950s to the 1970s, examining a time when the notion of the rich and famous flying to exotic locations around the world was a source of fascination and admiration for the general public. Former racing driver Jackie Stewart, psychologist Dr Martin Dyer Smith, columnist Ross Benson and one-time Concorde pilot Christopher Orlebar are seen reflecting on society's attitude to celebrity

programme.title: Metroland
programme.desc: In a documentary from 1973, poet Laureate John Betjeman takes a nostalgic look at the branch lines of the London Underground's Metropolitan Line and their meanderings through suburban Middlesex, Hertfordshire and Buckinghamshire

programme.title: Clive James: Postcard from Paris
programme.desc: In the 1960s as a young expatriate Australian writer, Clive James discovered Paris, which he felt was his spiritual home. In this programme he returns to the city and meets the writers, the models and the actresses who were part of a different world in his youth, and also encounters the unchanging arch-enemy of any visitor - the Paris taxi driver

programme.title: Victorian Sensations
programme.desc: Mathematician Dr Hannah Fry is joined by actor Paul McGann and psychotherapist Philippa Perry to explore the technology, art and culture of the last years of Queen Victoria's reign. In the first episode, Hannah investigates how innovations in science and technology - including the X-ray, safety bicycle and proto-aeroplane - transformed Britain in the 1890s, with the end of the 19th century marking the beginning of a new 'Electric Age'

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Two Russian film-makers follow the impact of the war inside their country. Their documentary finds that while thousands have fled, those that stayed have had to choose - to oppose, support or stay silent

programme.title: Stewart Copeland's Adventures in Music
programme.desc: The performer explores the transcendental powers of music and how certain sounds have the ability to move transport the mind and even help people briefly 'escape the world'. Stuart travels to Morocco to discover the polyrhythms of Gnawa and back to Wells Cathedral to understand the mechanics of choral polyphony. He meets Kanye West collaborator Caroline Shaw to examine melody and the effect of the human voice, CeCe Winans to discuss the roots of Gospel, takes a gong bath in New York and visits minimalist master Steve Reich to unpack the trance inducing powers of repetition

programme.title: Metroland
programme.desc: In a documentary from 1973, poet Laureate John Betjeman takes a nostalgic look at the branch lines of the London Underground's Metropolitan Line and their meanderings through suburban Middlesex, Hertfordshire and Buckinghamshire

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his Edwardian Bradshaw's guide, Michael Portillo conducts important research in an historic tea room, built by an Edwardian immigrant to the city of York. In Leeds he discovers the city's textile heritage, and also investigates Bradford's musical heritage

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: American artist Bob Ross offers further advice as he paints a tropical seascape - an exotic ocean masterpiece complete with palm trees swaying in the warm breeze

programme.title: Da Vinci: The Lost Treasure
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce travels to Florence, Milan, Paris and Warsaw to tell the story of Leonardo da Vinci's life, exploring why a man whose reputation rests on only a few pictures - including the Mona Lisa - is regarded as one of the greatest painters of all time. She also visits New York to see a recently discovered piece by the artist

programme.title: Art of France
programme.desc: Andrew Graham-Dixon examines the history of French art, revealing how it emerged from a struggle between tradition and revolution, and rulers and citizens. Starting with the invention of Gothic architecture, he traces its development up until the arrival of Classicism and the Age of Enlightenment

programme.title: Bent Coppers: Crossing the Line of Duty
programme.desc: Documentary examining corruption in the police in the 1970s, revealing a secret network of officers was operating illegally throughout London and led to the formation of the first internal anti-corruption unit A10, which inspired the BBC drama Line of Duty. The story begins in 1969, when a desperate south London criminal tipped off the Times about how he was being extorted for money by a detective in the Metropolitan Police

programme.title: Big Sky, Big Dreams, Big Art: Made in the USA
programme.desc: Waldemar Januszczak focuses on the art of the new cities of the east coast of America, with their futuristic skylines and lofty skyscrapers. He explores the squalid boxing rings painted by George Bellows, Reginald Mash's decadent away days on Coney Island and the escape into theosophy and abstraction mounted by Thomas Wilfred. He ends by looking at the harsh immigrant experience of Ellis Island and the profound impact that rootlessness had on the art of Mark Rothko.

programme.title: The Story of Welsh Art
programme.desc: Huw Stephens reveals how, as the 20th century dawned, artists found radical new ways to depict Wales, pushing themselves to extremes and redefining what art could be. His venture takes him to the National Museum Wales in Cardiff, Bardsey Island off the Llyn Peninsula, Colwyn Bay and Swansea

programme.title: Romancing the Stone: The Golden Ages of British Sculpture
programme.desc: Alastair Sooke tells the stories of sculptors John Flaxman, Francis Chantrey and Alfred Gilbert, who bucked trends in the 18th and 19th centuries. He examines the technical breakthroughs behind their key works - such as carving in marble with a pointer machine and the lost-wax technique - which were produced at a time of increased interest in sculptural projects to celebrate the size of the British Empire

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob Ross demonstrates the creation of the perfect brown-toned scene of a mountain at sunset

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel and Jean spend a nostalgic day in Buckinghamshire reliving their courtship days - but find things have changed in the intervening years. However, certain treasured memories remain. Originally shown in 1992

programme.title: The Mistress
programme.desc: The second series of Carla Lane's love triangle comedy, starring Felicity Kendal, Peter McEnery and Jane Asher. From 1987

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc: A chronicle of the English Civil War, revealing that behind the romantic stories of Cavaliers and Roundheads lies a terrible tale of tragedy and the death of innocents. The conflict saw hundreds of thousands of men, women and children killed, families torn apart and the nation divided, culminating in the public execution of King Charles I and the rise of Cromwell as Lord Protector

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: An exploration of the process of filming sex scenes in Hollywood movies, the toll these scenes take on those involved and the impact on women and girls in the real world. The film features candid interviews with actors and film-makers including Jane Fonda, Rosanna Arquette, Joey Soloway, Angela Robinson, Karyn Kusama, Rose McGowan, Alexandra Billings, Emily Meade and David Simon, and highlights the voices of women who have spoken out against abusive behaviour on their sets and were punished for it

programme.title: Africa with Ade Adepitan
programme.desc: Ade explores central Africa, travelling through Gabon, the Democratic Republic of Congo and Uganda. He investigates plans to develop a sustainable version of palm oil farming, meets a champion boxer helping to rehabilitate child soldiers, and talks to one of Africa's most outspoken political campaigners. He also reports on how conflict between militia groups influenced by foreign powers lies at the heart of the problems that have made the Democratic Republic of Congo arguably the most chaotic and corrupt country in Africa, as well as discovering how the conflict has impacted on the country's few remaining gorillas

When the baby birds, also called pufflings, eventually hatch, they fly out towards the ocean. programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Fulham v Leeds United (Kick-off 7.45pm). Gary Lineker presents all the action from the fifth-round tie at Craven Cottage. Goals by Aleksandar Mitrovic, Bobby Decordova-Reid and Willian helped Fulham record a 3-2 win when the sides met in the Premier League at Elland Road in October. They will be hopeful of recording a second victory of the season against United now they have home advantage, but Leeds may see this tie as a welcome distraction from their struggles in the Premier League. With analysis from Micah Richards, Danny Murphy and Jermaine Beckford

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Dark Land: Hunting the Killers
programme.desc: After builders discover a skeleton is discovered wrapped in carpet in a garden in Cardiff, forensic artist Richard Neave was called in to worked with the skull to create a clay bust of what the face may have looked like. Following a TV appeal, the victim was identified, leading the team revisit the case of 15 year-old Karen Price who ran away from care and catch her killer

programme.title: Rain Man (1988)
programme.desc: Brash yuppie car dealer Charlie discovers his deceased father has left the family fortune to Raymond, the autistic elder brother he never knew he had. In a bid to get his hands on the money, he tracks down and abducts Raymond - but the ensuing cross-country journey proves to be a profound learning experience for them both. Oscar-winning drama, starring Tom Cruise and Dustin Hoffman, with Valeria Golino, Gerald R Molen and Jack Murdock

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Leicester City v Arsenal at King Power Stadium and Bournemouth v Manchester City at Vitality Stadium. Arsenal and the Citizens will both have been expecting another three points to aid them in their respective title challenges, but Leicester and Bournemouth are also desperate for results to help them at the other end of the table. Plus, Everton v Aston Villa, Leeds United v Southampton, West Ham United v Nottingham Forest and Crystal Palace v Liverpool

programme.title: Sunday with Laura Kuenssberg
programme.desc: Interviews with key politicians and public figures

programme.title: The Sunday Show
programme.desc: Martin Geissler presents the main issues from the world of politics and beyond, featuring interviews, discussion and analysis on the stories that matter to Scotland

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Holly Hamilton present topical debate covering religious, moral and ethical issues, with guest panellists and contributions from viewers

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Wiltshire farmers Rebecca and Luke rear their cattle, sheep and pigs with the help of their four children. Cameras follow them as they take their meat to sell at Stroud Farmers' Market, where Gloucestershire fruit growers Helen and David are also hoping for a successful day's takings

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Kate Bliss and Mark Stacey help two teams scour an antiques fair in Harrogate, North Yorkshire. The teams have one hour to buy three items, which they send off to auction. Later, there's a tense atmosphere at Thomas Watsons auctioneers. Plus, host Anita Manning catches up with Charles Hanson and a very special musical collection.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: With St David's Day approaching, Katherine Jenkins meets pilgrims in Pembrokeshire walking the ancient trail to St David's Cathedral. Featuring hymns new and old from St Davids Cathedral and across Wales - and a special performance from Welsh actor and Hollywood star Luke Evans

programme.title: Lifeline
programme.desc: Claudia Winkleman appeals on behalf of Roald Dahl's Marvellous Children's Charity, which funds specialist nurses to help seriously ill children and support their families in the UK

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a globe-trotting couple to find a home in the Oxfordshire countryside, and discovers how the county is leading the way with the recycling of food waste

programme.title: The NeverEnding Story (1984)
programme.desc: A lonely boy, neglected by his father and bullied at school, finds comfort in a mysterious book about a young hero's quest to save his world from destruction. However, as he reads the tale, he begins to become part of the story. Fantasy adventure based on Michael Ende's novel, starring Barret Oliver, Noah Hathaway, Gerald McRaney, Moses Gunn and Patricia Hayes

programme.title: Serengeti
programme.desc: As the drought ends and the land returns to its former beauty, newborn giraffe Twiga takes his tentative first steps, trying to control his gangly legs - and he must learn quickly as lioness Kali is on the prowl. Another baby enters the elephant herd, and shortly after the newborn's father appears to greet his son in an awe-inspiring moment. Mafuta and the rest of the hippos return to the river, only to find the crocodiles have laid claim to the riverbank - so the hippos try to evict their old enemies

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Celebrating the 70th anniversary of the first recorded summit of the highest point on earth, Mount Everest, Ellie Harrison heads to Kettering and one of the world's most advanced materials research facilities to put outdoor gear - and herself - to the test. As well as getting to grips with a pair of expedition boots that made it to the top of the world, how will Ellie bear up in a cold chamber where the mercury can hit -40 degrees centigrade? Ellie also dips into the Countryfile archive to remember some pretty bracing encounters with the worst the weather can hurl at people

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents a special edition paying tribute to the nursing profession, filmed at St Thomas's and St Bartholomew's hospitals in the heart of London. The programme features objects that provide an insight into the history of nursing and healthcare, from medals awarded for bravery to early uniforms, cartoons and medical equipment. Fiona also meets comedian Jo Brand, a former psychiatric nurse, and hears the story of Jennifer Worth - the author of Call the Midwife

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The countdown to Trixie and Matthew's wedding officially begins, with Sister Veronica taking charge of organising the wedding gifts, while the bride's brother Geoffrey arriving and setting out to arrange the perfect hen party. However, the nuptials cause stress levels to escalate as a catalogue of disasters threaten to spoil the day. Meanwhile, a car crash leaves Dr Turner facing the biggest test of his career when he left to save a precious life, Nancy considers her and Colette's future and Sister Julienne hatches a plan to save Nonnatus House once and for all

programme.title: The Gold
programme.desc: DCI Boyce sets up surveillance on Noye's house in Kent, and they soon strike lucky when they follow Brian Reader from the property to a gold merchants in Bristol. As the evidence builds, raids are organised to arrest the gang, only for the operation to end in tragedy

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents highlights and analysis of the Premier League match between Tottenham Hotspur and Chelsea at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium. The London rivals shared the spoils in an entertaining 2-2 draw when they met at Stamford Bridge in August. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: Motty - The Man Behind the Sheepskin
programme.desc: An insight into the career of football commentator John Motson. The programme takes a look back at some of the moments and matches that have made him so popular with radio listeners and TV viewers, and features contributions from his wife Annie and son Freddie, colleagues Gary Lineker, Ian Wright, Trevor Brooking and Mark Lawrenson, and celebrity fans Noel Gallagher and Rod Stewart

programme.title: Moon (2009)
programme.desc: Astronaut Sam Bell has been working alone at an energy-generating base on the moon for three years and desperately longs to return home. After he is injured in an accident, he begins to discover the disturbing truth about the operation he is running, and is forced to question his own identity. Sci-fi drama, starring Sam Rockwell, with the voice of Kevin Spacey

The programme takes a look back at some of the moments and matches that have made him so popular with radio listeners and TV viewers, and features contributions from his wife Annie and son Freddie, colleagues Gary Lineker, Ian Wright, Trevor Brooking and Mark Lawrenson, and celebrity fans Noel Gallagher and Rod Stewart

programme.title: Moon (2009)
programme.desc: Astronaut Sam Bell has been working alone at an energy-generating base on the moon for three years and desperately longs to return home. After he is injured in an accident, he begins to discover the disturbing truth about the operation he is running, and is forced to question his own identity. Sci-fi drama, starring Sam Rockwell, with the voice of Kevin Spacey

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Kym Marsh host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood presents the story of an anxious family's 999 call to the police as they watched an intruder prowling around downstairs, live on their home security camera

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A house fire ends in tragedy when an attempt to cash-in on an insurance payout goes terribly wrong, and a window cleaner who says he cannot work is caught out on camera

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell visit two neighbouring cottages in Derbyshire, a terrace in Bolton and a semi in Leeds before they are sold under the hammer

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion and the teams shop for antiques in Peterborough, where experts Catherine Southon and Kate Bliss are on hand to help with the search. Christina flummoxes the fairgoers with a 2,000-year-old antique, and then it's off to Lichfield for the day's auction

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Rob treats Karen to a special night while Kirsty and Rich come to an understanding. Emma encourages Luca to talk to Jamie and Ruhma goes on a blind date

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: For Louise and Olly, a prize for their Beltex sheep at the Mid Devon Show is vital for their future. Amelia and Ben's Charollais sheep also meet the best breeders in the country

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a London couple on their country house hunt in Wiltshire. They have a generous ¬£1million budget to afford them space for their prized possessions - a baby grand piano and classic cars. Away from the property search, Nicki discovers more about the art of wooden hat block making, a critically endangered heritage craft being kept alive by a Wiltshire-based family whose blocks are used by milliners across the world

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Dealers Irita Marriot and Mark Hill set out on their first trip together. Irita buys a very rare tea-set, while Mark invests in mid-century Italian ceramics

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Quiz show hosted by Ross Kemp in which contestants compete for cash by crossing a bridge made up of stepping stones, each of which has a different option. The players must try to get from A to B by stepping on the truths and avoiding the lies in order to cross the studio floor safely, or risk falling off the bridge and out of the game

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Ronan Keating present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Zack and Whitney receive their baby's test results and Nish and Suki's marriage blessing ceremony is brought forward. A guilt-riddled Denise seduces Jack, and Denzel is shortlisted for 'The Walford Young Writers Competition'

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Whitney makes a difficult decision and Denzel's lies are exposed. Stacey and Eve re-open the bap van but chaos ensues when Nish accosts Eve while she's working. After Nish invites Honey to the marriage blessing, Suki is left in an awkward position

programme.title: Food Fest Northern Ireland
programme.desc: Colin Murray and Edith Bowman discover tips and treats at the food and music festival in Newcastle. They find out how to create award-winning burgers, discover the secrets of poutine, and how one man uses local produce to flavour his own special brand of chocolate. Chef Suzie Lee is down the road in Kilkeel to reveal exactly what scampi is and Ryan Hand finds out the superpowers of seeds

programme.title: Better
programme.desc: Col's latest attempt to procure an additional supply of drugs comes up short so he puts plans in place to get in touch with another associate in Bradford, but this is deemed a reckless move given he already has a deal with another family in the city, threatening to trigger a gang war. Owen and Donal grow ever closer, while Esther becomes curious about Lou's erratic behaviour

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Crisis pregnancy advice centres are supposed to help women with unplanned pregnancies, but an investigation reveals evidence that some clinics, operating outside the NHS, are giving misleading information and offering counselling that could persuade women not to have abortions. Reporter Divya Talwar also uncovers links between some UK centres and the anti-abortion movement in America

programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: It's sink or swim for the trainees as they face the daunting Water Power Challenge, aptly named Sink or Swim - and one trainee is tempted to ditch their Warrior

programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: Romance is in the air as a new trainee turns up the heat and, in the most brutal challenge yet, some trainees are pushed to breaking point. Presented by Jordan North and Paul Olima

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Oscar-winner Helen Mirren discusses her role in Shazam! Fury of the Gods. Multi award-winning actress, singer and dancer Ariana DeBose also appears, alongside Narcos star Pedro Pascal, who is promoting the new series of The Mandalorian. Plus, Freya Ridings performs her current single Weekends

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: A detective uncovers a criminal who has been targeting elderly people. A homeless musician's guitar is stolen by a mystery man and car thieves are caught struggling

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: Insurance investigators turn the tables on a woman claiming ¬£690,000 for personal injury claim after a surveillance operation reveals she's living life to the full. Plus, a minor bump on a petrol forecourt results in a false claim for whiplash. Presented by Naga Munchetty

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The redevelopment of a million-pound-plus house in Fulham, as well as the progress of auction buys in St Helens near Liverpool and Stoke in Staffordshire

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents the show from Wrexham, and discovers the story of The Ladies of Llangollen. Roo Irvine and Philip Serrell provide expert advice to today's teams

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Ollie comes home from the Army with a surprise, while Nina arrives at the Mill and makes her mark. Scarlett is asked out by old work colleague, but he's getting 'coaching' on how to seduce her

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Beekeepers Debbie and Chris collect honey from their hives, while vegetable and fruit farmers Paul and Jackie gather their crops for the Winchester Farmer's Market

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah goes property shopping in rural Devon with a couple who have a ¬£350,000 budget and hope to find a home that has both a workshop and an art studio

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Irita and Mark continue their road trip looking for antique treasures in Bedford. Irita is excited by a 200 year-old regency ornament while Mark finds some Victorian anatomy moulds

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Ross Kemp hosts the game show in which friends Lauren, Kate, Katie and Emily walk across the bridge, stepping on the truths and avoiding the lies, in a bid to take home the cash

programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Fulham v Leeds United (Kick-off 7.45pm). Gary Lineker presents all the action from the fifth-round tie at Craven Cottage. Goals by Aleksandar Mitrovic, Bobby Decordova-Reid and Willian helped Fulham record a 3-2 win when the sides met in the Premier League at Elland Road in October. They will be hopeful of recording a second victory of the season against United now they have home advantage, but Leeds may see this tie as a welcome distraction from their struggles in the Premier League. With analysis from Micah Richards, Danny Murphy and Jermaine Beckford

programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Rain Man (1988)
programme.desc: Brash yuppie car dealer Charlie discovers his deceased father has left the family fortune to Raymond, the autistic elder brother he never knew he had. In a bid to get his hands on the money, he tracks down and abducts Raymond - but the ensuing cross-country journey proves to be a profound learning experience for them both. Oscar-winning drama, starring Tom Cruise and Dustin Hoffman, with Valeria Golino, Gerald R Molen and Jack Murdock

programme.desc: Iagan MacNeil finds out about the landscape and history along the St Cuthbert's Way, starting off at Melrose Abbey, where he talks to Iain Craig of Historic Environment Scotland. programme.desc: Gabby becomes frustrated, Sam gets himself in trouble and Lydia tries to come up with a plan to keep him out of prison, and there's a shock in store for Bob and Bernice.
