A CT scan reveals he has suffered multiple fractures and loss of blood flow to his right arm. Without circulation he will lose the limb, so the medical team tries everything to save it, including complicated surgery. Meanwhile, 95-year-old Betty is brought in after experiencing breathing difficulties at home, and retired engineer James, 63, has a nasty cut to his head and weakness in his arms following a tumble down the stairs

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Angela and Steve from Leicestershire have been to Lanzarote on holiday more than 100 times, and now they want to realise their long-held dream of owning a holiday home in the Playa Blanca area, which Angela hopes that they can move to permanently once Steve retires. Jasmine Harman shows them five properties within their budget of ¬£225,000

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp helps Amber and Colin turn their bedroom into a dream vintage haven. After an initial assessment, the presenter begins by getting rid of any mass-produced furniture

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sairan from London cannot wait to buy a holiday home for herself and her grown-up daughters to enjoy on Spain's popular western Costa del Sol. She is joined by her daughter Lana, but they can't decide which property to go for, as Laura Hamilton delivers five contenders for Sairan's budget of ¬£110,000

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A restaurant in the Algarve finally opens its doors, and a pony trekking business in Italy hangs in the balance after receiving a visit from an army of vets

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: In Suffolk, Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien meet former agony aunt Janet, whose garden shed is crammed with goodies. With no motors to unearth, Henry makes a rare furniture discovery, while Simon finds a vintage tram bench

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: On the Isle of Wight, Henry Cole finds an unusual three-wheeled motorbike and Simon O'Brien unearths an old projector screen that he wants to turn into a work of art

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The search is on to find relatives of a south Londoner who overcame tragedy to become a celebrated jazz singer. Meanwhile, on the valuable estate of a war veteran, the discovery of a mystery boy threatens to undermine weeks of research

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The latest competition begins in Norfolk at the Old Ram Coaching Inn, one of five-star-trained Victoria MacDonald's three B&B sites. At breakfast, Aaron fumes over his eggs, and Alan and Alison's feedback leaves Victoria reaching for the tissues

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Ye Old Crown in Edenbridge, Kent, where chef and owner Aaron Webster aims to deliver a three star service for a two star price

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Alan and Alison play host to the others at the Farmer's Arms in Taunton, where they hope their palatial rooms will help them win. But a dusty radiator might be their undoing

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with househunters who were keen to fly the nest. In 2017, Chloe was looking to move out of her parental home and find her own slice of Reading. But Chloe's dad, who was helping with funds, had his own idea of what kind of place his daughter should buy, which didn't align with her own thoughts. In 2019, Ella and Grant were looking for their own place to start their lives together. But as Phil soon realised, Grant seemed nervous about moving out of his mum's house

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet Lauren and Christian Grant in Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk, who are unsure whether to sell or upgrade their house. Christian dreams of a home bursting with character, but Lauren thinks that they can refurbish their four-bedroom detached property to make it more suitable for them and their two small children

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: Dick, Angel, Arthur and Dorothy share more enchanting tales from the Chateau, as they continue the renovation of their 19th-century fairytale home and grounds. With weddings and events on hold for the second year, Dick and Angel bite the bullet and make the big decision to tackle the exterior of the Chateau. The roof and outside walls are their biggest project to date and the Chateau quickly becomes a building site

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of 37-year-old Angelo Mastropietro, as he transforms a damp, dark and abandoned cave in Worcestershire. Having recently been diagnosed with multiple sclerosis, Angelo wants to create a retreat to help him cope with the news and become a 21st-century caveman. He has a budget of ¬£100,000 and plans to almost single-handedly carve, cut and drill into the hillside to make the cave comfortable for contemporary living. However, there is no manual for a project of this kind, and the unique challenge soon becomes an obsession

programme.title: Home Greek Home
programme.desc: Sarah Moore renovates a house on the Greek island of Skiathos after buying it without seeing it during lockdown. Having spent many years holidaying and working on the island, Sarah has developed a deep connection to Skiathos and has long dreamt of owning a house there. The family visit the house for the first time and learn about the complications that come with renovating a house in a country with different rules and regulations

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Eleven-month-old Isabel is rushed to St George's after suffering a seizure and losing consciousness, while 22-year-old Felix is brought to A&E with a self-inflicted stab wound to his stomach. Retired engineer Bill, 68, fell 15ft from a ladder while cutting a leylandii hedge. He arrives by air ambulance with breathing difficulties and suspected multiple fractures

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: In Warwick, a 46-year-old man is paralysed from his neck down six weeks after major spinal surgery. Paramedic David Hastie and student paramedic Esme Jenkins need to move him with extreme care: one false move could mean he will never walk again. At the same time, paramedics in Birmingham treat a man who has chest pains after being involved in a hit-and-run incident

programme.desc: A grand tour of the Ferrari Roma production facility in Northern Italy. Titch lifts the lid on an icon of the 1960s - the series one Jaguar E-type

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick explores the Fowey Estuary, one of Cornwall's hidden secrets, joining a friend on a boat trip to learn about the history of the area and getting a unique view of the buildings along the riverbank. He discovers the area's history of piracy, meets a family that make award-winning vodka, and makes a pancake with a wild blackberry compote and Cornish clotted cream

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: On the wild north Atlantic coast, Rick heads out to sea to go fishing for lobsters with his old friend and celebrity chef Nathan Outlaw, before helping to cook up a lobster risotto. Later, at Tresillian House near Newquay, Rick meets with head gardener John Harris to find out more about his Victorian walled garden

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the international event in London, as amateur drivers put their home-made, gravity-powered vehicles through an obstacle-littered course. The judges for the event at Alexandra Palace were snowboarder Katie Ormerod, racing driver Andrew Jordan, grime artist Blakie and 2015 Red Bull Soapbox Race podium finisher Tony Whitelaw, while contestants included Team Brooklands Special, 24 Seconds of Le Ally Pally and Team Rockin' Rolla

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff, Paddy McGuinness and Chris Harris set out to find interesting old cars for new drivers, then put them to the test on a road trip through Devon and Cornwall. Chris also drives the original supercar, Lamborghini's legendary Miura

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Chris Harris, Paddy McGuiness and Freddie Flintoff aren't choosing their own cars, but instead choosing for one another. After unwrapping their presents in the Welsh village of Bethlehem, the trio set off on a yuletide trek across Britain, stopping off to play the game of 'High-Speed Visual Charades' and deliver an enormous tree to the Unesco World Heritage city of Bath. Then it's time for the presenters to visit the Top Gear test track, transformed into a winter wonderland of speed

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Lucy get a family pet in an attempt to teach the children to be more responsible. But as ever, things do not quite work out as planned. Domestic comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton, with a guest appearance from former EastEnders actress Annette Badland (Aunt Babe)

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in the domestic comedy which sees the couple appear to go from one disaster to the next, while coping with their three kids, Lucy's disapproving parents, Lee's feckless dad Frank and their world-weary friends Toby and Anna. This week the couple become addicted to a TV box set, causing them to cancel dinner with Toby and Anna at the last moment. But when they lie about the reason, it only succeeds in opening up a huge can of worms. Domestic comedy, with Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden

programme.title: Not Going Out

Jeremy Clarkson and James May join forces to create a public information film to promote safer cycling, with their efforts presented to a panel of experts including members of Westminster Council and Olympic gold medal-winning rider Chris Boardman. To make matters more complicated, all three presenters are racing not only one another but also the Stig, who is making his way toward the finish line by public transport. programme.title: Joanna Lumley's India
programme.desc: Joanna Lumley travels back to the country of her birth, travelling the length and breadth of India to explore its diverse landscapes and cultural traditions. In this episode, her epic journey begins in Tamil Nadu, where she witnesses religious ceremonies in glorious temples, before visiting Gangtok in Sikkim, the place where her mother lived as a child

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's India
programme.desc: Joanna meets the Maharaja of Dungarpur who shows her around his lakeside palace, and a Dalit community in Gujarat, considered to be India's lowest caste. Braving the roads of Mumbai, Joanna takes a ride in the city's only all-female taxi company and visits the Times of India, where her uncle was editor of the paper in the 1930s and 40s. She then overcomes her fear of heights to explore the World One Tower, soon to be Mumbai's tallest luxury residential building

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's India
programme.desc: Joanna's adventures across India conclude as she explores Rajasthan, Delhi and the mountainous North West, before ending in Kashmir, the place of her birth. Her first stop takes her to the Ranthambhore National Park, where she learns about the Wildlife Protection Society of India's tiger conservation programmes. Joanna's next stop takes her to the city of Delhi, where she begins her exploration of the capital at Humayun's Tomb, before ending her 5000 mile journey in Srinagar in Kashmi, the place where she was born

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues following the route Queen Victoria took from Windsor Castle to the Isle of Wight, and reveals the oil fields hidden beneath some of England's seaside resorts. During his journey, he also explores the role the Dorset town of Weymouth played in the D-Day landings during the Second World War, and visits the site of Victorian Britain's most famous building rock in Portland

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a journey to Chichester, with the first leg beginning in Norwich. At the city's Norman castle he uncovers the Victorian public's gory fascination with crime and punishment and finds out how campaigners such as Elizabeth Fry worked to improve conditions for prisoners. Heading west to Thetford, he explores how the Victorian appetite for rabbits and their fur led to special train services to London, and ends in the Suffolk town of Brandon, where he tries his hand at flint-knapping

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Ipswich to Chelmsford, starting at an agricultural implements works with its own railway sidings. programme.title: SAS: Who Dares Wins
programme.desc: The remaining recruits' will to survive is severely tested with an extraction task used in the Vietnam War, and there's an intense beasting in a fight for the survival of the fittest. With the hardships of the jungle closing in, a lack of sleep, a calorie deficit from ration packs, and their bodies starting to fail, will any of the recruits make it through a survival task that requires navigating through the jungle pursued by hunters during a mission behind enemy lines?

programme.title: SAS: Who Dares Wins
programme.desc: The remaining recruits are ambushed and handed over to interrogators for questioning. They must endure psychological and physical punishments designed to break their will while sticking to their cover story. The end is near but will the final seven prove magnificent or not?

programme.desc: Myka and Pete deal with a zombie plague spread by an unknown artefact, and Claudia tries to reach Jinks. Sci-fi thriller, starring Eddie McClintock, Joanne Kelly and Saul Rubinek

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Picard is persuaded to take a much-needed holiday on the tropical planet of Risa, where a beautiful woman and a clutch of aliens involve him in the hunt for a secret weapon. Sci-fi drama, starring Patrick Stewart and Jonathan Frakes

programme.title: The Librarians
programme.desc: The world is morphed into a horrible and unrecognisable place - one where the Library never existed - and it is up to Baird to bring the Librarians together

programme.title: Star Trek: Voyager
programme.desc: A spatial distortion damages Voyager, trapping several crew members and leaving Janeway injured. The race is on to reverse the process before the entire ship becomes immobilised permanently.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride becomes convinced that Paul Jenks, the so-called 'Baitfish' has returned. Jenks was the former informant who set a bomb that nearly killed Pride's daughter, and Pride is obviously highly motivated to track him down. However, his colleagues become increasingly concerned about the lengths to which he will go to catch his nemesis, including attempts to form an alliance with the Broussard crime family. Scott Bakula and Lucas Black star

programme.title: S.W.A.T.
programme.desc: The mayor gives Lynch the task of enacting a departmental review of the squad just as Hondo and the team are pursuing the unstable and dangerous fugitive leader of a doomsday cult

programme.title: Grimm
programme.desc: Nick and Hank investigate the case of a teenager who was attacked while breaking into a house, and finds the homeowners are not what they appear to be

programme.title: Snapped
programme.desc: Police piece together haunting clues when a young mother is killed and her family is critically injured

programme.title: How I Caught the Killer
programme.desc: The FBI investigates when a seemingly perfect husband flees the United States following the murder of his wife and three children

programme.title: Brit Cops
programme.desc: Violent drunks and drug dealers causes problems in West Wales, while traffic officers combat vandals who are terrorising walkers in the mountains

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong

programme.title: London's Weekend
programme.desc: A chance to catch up on the week's headlines and a taste of what to see and do in London this weekend

programme.title: My Greek Odyssey
programme.desc: Peter Maneas journeys through some of the most spectacular and unique Greek islands, exploring the rich culture, history and food of Greece while meeting the locals and those who live there

programme.title: The Prisoner
programme.desc: Number Six faces a threat to his sanity in the midst of a masked ball, where he meets Peter Pan and Little Bo Peep and finds himself being placed on trial for making an audacious bid to foil his captors. Cult drama, starring Patrick McGoohan

programme.title: World Natural Heritage: Colombia
programme.desc: The UNESCO National Park Malpelo, located in the Eastern Pacific, 500k off the Colombian coast

programme.title: Revolution in Colour
programme.desc: Part one of a two part documentary exploring the struggle for Irish independence in the early 20th century. Professor Eunan O'Halpin examines the years leading up to the 1918 British general election, which saw a rise in radicalisation among both Nationalists and Unionists

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: Change is on the way to the sleepy market town of Cranford as the railway pushes out from Manchester, but many of the female residents are more excited about the arrival of the handsome new doctor, Frank Harrison. Adapted by Heidi Thomas, with an all-star cast including Judi Dench and Eileen Atkins, who was awarded a Bafta for her role as the authoritative Miss Deborah Jenkyns

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Featuring Lee, Bermondsey and Stratford. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Zoo Robbery ()
programme.desc: With Paul Gyngell. When the world's only yeti in captivity is kidnapped from London Zoo, a group of children succeed in rescuing it

programme.title: Once a Jolly Swagman (1949)
programme.desc: A former factory worker achieves fame and fortune as a professional speedway rider, at the expense of his marriage. Drama, starring Dirk Bogarde and Bonar Colleano

programme.title: Calamity the Cow (1967)
programme.desc: A farmer's children prepare a cow for a livestock show, but at the last moment, it is stolen by a rival. Children's comedy, starring John Moulder-Brown and Elizabeth Dear

programme.title: Lionheart (1968)
programme.desc: A lion escapes from a circus but is rescued and protected by a young boy. Children's drama, starring James Forlong and Louise Rush

programme.title: Tabernacle Choir: Music and Words
programme.desc: The Tabernacle Choir from Temple Square, Music and the Spoken Word, providing music and inspiration for everyday living from one of the world's top ten choirs featuring regular guest artists.

programme.title: Inside Tatler
programme.desc: Features editor Sophia Money-Coutts travels to castles in Scotland to find out what their owners think about Scottish independence and how their circumstances would be affected. Over in Moscow, the staff of Tatler Russia report on the country's emerging elite who are trying to create their own high society and look to British upper-class traditions to help them, with the magazine recommending the best UK boarding schools and hosting a debutante ball

programme.title: My Greek Odyssey
programme.desc: Peter Maneas journeys through some of the most spectacular Greek islands, exploring the rich culture, history and food of Greece while meeting the locals and those who live there

programme.title: Brighton (2019)
programme.desc: With Larry Lamb. Two working class couples go on a day trip to Brighton which ends in disaster

programme.title: Haraam (2018)
programme.desc: A man tries to pluck up the courage to profess his love to a departing co-worker of a very different cultural, ethnic and religious background before she leaves on her last day of work. Drama, starring Ainy Jaffri and Cherno Jagne

programme.title: The Comic Strip Presents
programme.desc: A satire on Hitchcock's distinctive interpretation of Daphne du Maurier's Rebecca. The maid Consuela receives a new mistress. Comedy, starring Dawn French and Jennifer Saunders

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing Brixton and Harmondsworth for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: The Great Train Robbery
programme.desc: First of a two-part drama by Broadchurch writer Chris Chibnall telling the story of the most infamous heist in British history, beginning with the planning and execution of the crime from the perspective of the perpetrators themselves. After a robbery at Heathrow Airport in 1962, Bruce Reynolds sets his sights on another target - the plan being to rob the overnight mail train from Glasgow to Euston. A team is assembled, schemes are laid out and rehearsals begin. But despite their meticulous planning, the operation is compromised by an attack on the train driver and a botched getaway. Before long, the gang have become the most wanted men in Britain. Luke Evans, Paul Anderson, Martin Compston, Jack Roth and Neil Maskell star

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: News Rewind
programme.desc: A digest of news and events from across London from the past few days

programme.title: Talking Points
programme.desc: 'Current affairs affecting Londoners today and a look at the latest shows and films in the capital

programme.title: Roswell Conspiracies
programme.desc: The story of allied intelligence agents who've discovered aliens on Earth who are bent on taking over the world. In response, the agents form a top-secret multinational agency, The Global Alliance

programme.title: Dork Hunters from Outer Space
programme.desc: Alien Dorks disguise themselves as humans to use Earth as a base to take over the universe, but they face opposition from some unlikely teenage heroes

programme.title: Pocket Dragon Adventures
programme.desc: A group of very small dragons live with a kindly old wizard, they're not big enough to fly but that doesn't stop them having many adventures

programme.title: Extreme Dinosaurs
programme.desc: 65 Million years ago, Dinosaurs disappeared. Now they're Back! T-Bone, Spike, Bullzeye, and Stegz. Four prehistoric dinosaurs, evolved into intelligent beings reawaken in a bizarre new world

programme.title: Stone Age
programme.desc: Meet a group of typical suburban nine-year-old kids with friends, foes and families kicking it really old school, in prehistoric times

programme.title: Stone Age
programme.desc: Meet a group of typical suburban nine-year-old kids with friends, foes and families kicking it really old school, in prehistoric times

programme.title: Legend of the Dragon
programme.desc: The guardian of the temple has passed on and a new Golden Dragon must be Chosen from a brother and sister - Twins born in the Year of the Dragon. Only one will be chosen. Their sibling bond tested

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: Members of the Moonbase Alpha crew discover a region filled with ruined spaceships, which they believe has been attacked by a deadly creature. Koenig tries to find out the truth before it is too late. Martin Landau stars

programme.title: Plane Crash Recreated
programme.desc: Survivors recall a routine flight from London Heathrow to Belfast International Airport that ended in tragedy when British Midland Flight 92 crashed onto a motorway embankment near the town of Kegworth on 8th January 1989

programme.title: Terry and Mason's Great Food Trip
programme.desc: Broadcaster Terry Wogan and London cabbie Mason McQueen continue their culinary journey in Salisbury, where they taste lardy cakes in the historic market place and eat venison stew in a coaching inn with a very dubious past. They also visit the home of watercress, enjoy a curry cooked on a fire where the locals' earliest ancestors lived and meet a 12ft giant who has presided over the city since the 14th century

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Monroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of the amazing city that normally lie undiscovered

programme.title: Castle Builders
programme.desc: Examining the blood, sweat and vision behind Europe's castles, from the nobles' plans to the craftsmen's practical know-how

programme.title: Up in the World (1956)
programme.desc: A bumbling window cleaner is elated to land a job at an aristocrat's country house. However, the spoilt young heir to the estate likes to play pranks on him - and lands the hapless servant in very hot water after the pair make a trip to a nightclub together and walk straight into a kidnap plot. Comedy, starring Norman Wisdom, Michael Caridia, Maureen Swanson and Jerry Desmonde

programme.title: Tales of Beatrix Potter
programme.desc: The Royal Ballet performs Frederick Ashton's family ballet, bringing to life Beatrix Potter's famous images and children's stories. Created for a film in 1971 featuring music arranged by John Lanchbery from popular Victorian and Edwardian melodies, the production brings to the Covent Garden stage such colourful figures as Jemima Puddleduck, Jeremy Fisher, Mrs Tiggywinkle, Mr Fox and the irrepressible Peter Rabbit

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Monroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered.

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Rudyard Kipling: A Secret Life
programme.desc: A profile of the author, which looks at how the writer's childhood and the loss of two of his three children influenced his work

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London

programme.title: The Baron
programme.desc: Mannering is about to give a valuation for a client when the man dies. This leads the Baron and Cordelia to an old dark house in the country where mysterious goings on have been reported

programme.title: Cat Hospital
programme.desc: Fern, a beautiful blue Burmese and one of the Cat Hospital's oldest patients takes a turn for the worse. Franklin, a prize-winning Maine coon, a novice when it comes to females meets Ruby - but will romance ensue? Veterinary specialist Clare Meade meets a visiting cat called Honey

programme.title: Danger Dogs
programme.desc: Documentary following dogs and their trainers as they are put through their paces in everything from sniffing out drugs to finding roadside bombs in conflict zones

programme.title: The Comic Strip Presents
programme.desc: An attractive couple move to a seemingly quiet close, where they discover the previous occupants met a mysterious death involving a waterbed. It soon turns out their neighbours are part of a wife-swapping circle - but it remains to be seen whether any of them could be guilty of murder. Old Comic Strip faces Rik Mayall and Nigel Planer star alongside a new generation of comic talent

programme.title: Quest Boxing League
programme.desc: Welcome to the UK's toughest boxing competition, where aspiring young boxers battle it out inside the ring for their chance to be crowned the Quest Boxing League Champion

programme.title: A Patch of Fog (2015)
programme.desc: A famous writer and academic living off the reputation of his single novel resorts to shoplifting to introduce some excitement to his stable life. He is caught in the act by a lonely, unbalanced security guard, who has an unusual price for his silence - he wants them to be friends, and goes to disturbing lengths to force himself into the author's life. Thriller, starring Stephen Graham, Conleth Hill and Lara Pulver

programme.title: A Shock to the System (1990)
programme.desc: A frustrated executive accidentally pushes a homeless man into the path of a subway train. Realising he has got away with one killing, he begins to wonder how many more murders he can pull off - starting with his rivals at work, his nagging wife and anyone else who has ever caused him misery. Black comedy, starring Michael Caine, Elizabeth McGovern, Peter Riegert and Swoosie Kurtz

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Bloody Mama (1970)
programme.desc: A poverty-stricken psychotic woman goes on a rampage against society along with her homicidal children, robbing banks, kidnapping the wealthy and resorting to murder at the drop of a hat. Thriller based on the story of the infamous Ma Barker, starring Shelley Winters, Robert De Niro, Robert Walden, Don Stroud, Clint Kimbrough. Pat Hingle and Bruce Dern

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Featuring Woolwich, Deptford and Lewisham. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Calamity the Cow (1967)
programme.desc: A farmer's children prepare a cow for a livestock show, but at the last moment, it is stolen by a rival. Children's comedy, starring John Moulder-Brown and Elizabeth Dear

programme.title: Roswell Conspiracies
programme.desc: The story of allied intelligence agents who've discovered aliens on Earth who are bent on taking over the world. In response, the agents form a top-secret multinational agency, The Global Alliance

programme.title: Dork Hunters from Outer Space
programme.desc: Alien Dorks disguise themselves as humans to use Earth as a base to take over the universe, but they face opposition from some unlikely teenage heroes

programme.title: Pocket Dragon Adventures
programme.desc: A group of very small dragons live with a kindly old wizard, they're not big enough to fly but that doesn't stop them having many adventures

programme.title: Extreme Dinosaurs
programme.desc: 65 Million years ago, Dinosaurs disappeared. Now they're Back! T-Bone, Spike, Bullzeye, and Stegz. Four prehistoric dinosaurs, evolved into intelligent beings reawaken in a bizarre new world

programme.title: Stone Age
programme.desc: Meet a group of typical suburban nine-year-old kids with friends, foes and families kicking it really old school, in prehistoric times

programme.title: Stone Age
programme.desc: Meet a group of typical suburban nine-year-old kids with friends, foes and families kicking it really old school, in prehistoric times

programme.title: Legend of the Dragon
programme.desc: The guardian of the temple has passed on and a new Golden Dragon must be Chosen from a brother and sister - Twins born in the Year of the Dragon. Only one will be chosen. Their sibling bond tested

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: Moonbase Alpha receives a distress call from the survivors of a dying planet, and discover a world where half the inhabitants have reverted to barbarism in an effort to stay alive. Guest starring Joan Collins, with Martin Landau and Barbara Bain

programme.title: Castle Builders
programme.desc: Examining the blood, sweat and vision behind Europe's castles, from the nobles' plans to the craftsmen's practical know-how

programme.title: Terry and Mason's Great Food Trip
programme.desc: Terry Wogan and Mason McQueen continue their culinary journey around the nation, abandoning the cab for a punt along the River Cherwell in Oxford. Terry visits the city's old jail and they investigate the origins of the Oxford sausage and the famous old Oxford marmalade factory, before meeting students at the university who have formed a society to assess the scientific benefits of pizza

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Monroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered

programme.title: World Natural Heritage: Costa Rica
programme.desc: From the pacific coast up to the tropical rainforests of Costa Rica. Experience an untouched, pure jungle, home to iguanas, venomous snakes, capuchin monkeys

programme.title: Never Let Go (1960)
programme.desc: A salesman is forced to desperate measures when his car is stolen, putting his career and marriage on the line. Crime drama, starring Richard Todd and Peter Sellers

programme.title: Up in the World (1956)
programme.desc: A bumbling window cleaner is elated to land a job at an aristocrat's country house. However, the spoilt young heir to the estate likes to play pranks on him - and lands the hapless servant in very hot water after the pair make a trip to a nightclub together and walk straight into a kidnap plot. Comedy, starring Norman Wisdom, Michael Caridia, Maureen Swanson and Jerry Desmonde

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Monroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered

programme.title: The Baron
programme.desc: Mannering is about to give a valuation for a client when the man dies. This leads the Baron and Cordelia to an old dark house in the country where mysterious goings on have been reported

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London

programme.title: Revolution in Colour
programme.desc: Part two of two. Professor Eunan O'Halpin investigates the struggle for Irish independence in the years after the end of the First World War, and the outbreak of civil war in 1922

programme.title: The Prisoner
programme.desc: Number Six becomes a pawn in a human game of chess while trying to recruit an army of like-minded souls - and learns to judge the Villagers' allegiances by their moves. Cult drama, starring Patrick McGoohan

programme.title: The Great Train Robbery
programme.desc: The police wake to the news of a robbery, but the full extent of the crime and its haul - ¬£2.6million - only becomes evident over the following days. It's clear the local CID is ill-equipped to solve a case of such magnitude, so Scotland Yard is called in, with a six-strong team of detectives headed by the Flying Squad's enigmatic chief Tommy Butler. In a race against time, they set out to identify every criminal involved and bring them to justice before they flee the country - but even if they can, will they find the money? Jim Broadbent stars in the concluding part of the drama about the most infamous heist in British history, with George Costigan, Robert Glenister, Tim Pigott-Smith, Nick Moran and John Salthouse. Written by Broadchurch creator Chris Chibnall

programme.title: Brighton (2019)
programme.desc: With Larry Lamb. Two working class couples go on a day trip to Brighton which ends in disaster

programme.title: Haraam (2018)
programme.desc: A man tries to pluck up the courage to profess his love to a departing co-worker of a very different cultural, ethnic and religious background before she leaves on her last day of work. Drama, starring Ainy Jaffri and Cherno Jagne

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Rudyard Kipling: A Secret Life
programme.desc: A profile of the author, which looks at how the writer's childhood and the loss of two of his three children influenced his work

programme.title: Lionheart (1968)
programme.desc: A lion escapes from a circus but is rescued and protected by a young boy. Children's drama, starring James Forlong and Louise Rush

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing Crystal Palace and Shoreditch. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Black Hairapy
programme.desc: Short documentary exploring the relationship between Afro hair and identity within the UK Afro-Caribbean community

programme.title: Live EFL Cup
programme.desc: Manchester United v Newcastle United (Kick-off 4.30pm). Live coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium. The Red Devils last lifted this trophy in 2017 and eliminated Aston Villa, Burnley, Charlton Athletic and Nottingham Forest to reach this showpiece occasion. Newcastle's last major domestic trophy of any kind came back when they won the FA Cup in 1955, but hopes will be high of them ending that long drought after victories over Tranmere Rovers, Crystal Palace, Bournemouth and Leicester City en route to this match
